review: Killer food and great service makes a place good in my book

We have been to this particular location multiple times and it has just gone down hill.  The service has always been excellent and on point, but the food has gotten very bland.  We specifically went to try the new bacon burger.  My husband got the Royal which he always gets and I ordered the new bacon burger.  The fries may be bottomless, but it doesn't make a difference if they are also bland and mushy. The burgers were bland and were in desperate need of seasoning.  Half way through we added the seasoning that was on the table, and it helped slightly.  I am very disappointed.  Neither my husband, son or I are interested in giving this place another chance.
Burgers are the best I've had.  The servers have always been friendly, enthusiastic, and kind when I was there (even when they had difficult customers)

We were in Canton for 4 days and had 3 meals here.... I'm not one to frequent anything other than a Starbucks regularly on vacation... but this particular Red Robin made we want to come back. The food was your typical Red Robin fare... burgers, steak fries, sodas, and a full bar. Our first visit was a late dinner. 2 Royals, the cod sandwich, and a regular cheeseburger. We also had a few margaritas and a couple of beers. Nothing about the food itself stood out, however, the SERVICE WAS PHENOMENAL. Between the management checking in on us, our server being on top of ordering, getting everything out in a timely manner, and the bussers clearing empty plates/glasses and refilling waters.... It was like a symphony. I've had this type of service at high-end restaurants, but would never expect it from a Red Robin. Needless to say, we tipped well that night. The following day we came with a large group. 3 in our group had never been to an RR (don't ask me how they've lived 35+ years of their life in the USA and have never eaten at a Red Robin). Just like the previous night, service was stellar.  We thought... this couldn't possibly happen a third time. But it did. Oh it did. Just two of us this third time.... but the service was just as on point. Man.... the management at this store needs to go around the country and teach other locations how to get service right. They're doing a FANTASTIC job!!!

Filthy silverware and a $10 hamburger that looked like it had been partially eaten already.  Manager on duty offered to order me a new one, but after he exchanged my filthy silverware for even filthier silverware, I couldn't really trust his judgement.  Sent it away - lost my appetite.

I'm being bit generous with my stars here, because this is one of the few places in the area that my kids get excited about going and actually eat the food that they're given.  The service is always very nice and patient with the kids, the food is fine for chain fare, and I've never had to wait very long.  HOWEVER... this place is always FILTHY.  Everything is sticky... tables, salt shakers, ketchup, menus, high chairs, floors, everything.  The manager (who was tied up with another table on my last visit) really needs to step up and make this a priority because it's bad.

The food gets about 3-4 stars, but the horrible service and filth knock this review way down. Even my folder my check was brought in was sticky - yuck. So I would have been happier over at Five Guys, but my daughter want to come here for her 7th birthday with our family and her best friend. Besides, they have balloons and sing to you, right?  Not in our case apparently. We arrived around 3:20pm this past Saturday (3/8/14) with a party of 8. We were told the wait would be 45-60 minutes.  My daughter did not care and want to stay and wait... ok, fair enough.  We were actually seated in less than 15 minutes... so far so good. I let the hostess know it was my daughter's 7th birthday and that she was excited to be there.  "Tell your server" is all she said. Ok. Our server introduced himself and I proceeded to let him know. He acknowledged the birthday and took our drink orders. Then we placed our food orders. We waited until after the food came for silverware and drink refills were scarce and by request only. One of our guests was offered more fries (lucky dog). As the meal wound down and it was clear we were ready for our check, my daughter's friend reminded our server once again "It's her birthday today". He chuckled and said "I know". About 10 minutes later we were asked if we'd like dessert or anything else. We skipped dessert as birthday cake was waiting at home. After that, he brought the check and said "have a nice day". I was really, really ticked off. My daughter was confused as the waitress two tables over led a Happy Birthday Chorus to another patron. I tipped the waiter $1 on a $76.00 bill and noted that the tip would have been $20, but he completely blew off what we were there for.  Between the lack of cleanliness and the disregard for customer service, I will not be back to Red Robin.  If I want a great burger, I will cook at home. If I want a great burger and happy workers, I will go to Five Guys. I won't be back here though.

We went to Red Robin for my cousin's birthday and it was overall an average experience. We were seated immediately and our waiter, Trent, was extremely friendly and quick. However, the food took a long time to arrive and it wasn't even that busy. The restaurant seemed a bit dirty like a film over everything-odd. Once the food came it was very good. I had the Red's Tavern Double and it was very juicy and tasty. The bottomless fries are very good. Once we were finished it took a long time for our check to get to our table causing us to almost be late for our next activity. Overall it was average.

1 star for somewhat better than a fast food burger and fries.    Service all around is no good from the front door.   Told 20 min wait which turned into 40.  Watched the hostess tick off 2 different groups of people waiting by letting people seat themselves in the bar.  Then she threw a hissy fit herself when those people sit at tables in the bar.    Nice first impression.   Table service seemed to be the same for all the tables regardless of who you had.  Wait wait wait.   Had to stop her and ask for the cheese that was supposed to be on the burger because she never came back to check on the table.   No drink refills.   Glad to be done!
Great place, seated right away, our server Anna was A+++++ food was great. Thank you Red Robin!! And thank you Anna for the great service!!

Server was very pleasant , joke with us ! Just came in for a quick salad while out shopping ! Mom and I got a salad to split . Our server Anna was amazing ! She had the kitchen split our salad into separate plates for us ! How nice ! Haven't been there in forever ! Definitely returning and asking for Anna as our server !

Very impressed with the service. From the hostess to servers everyone we came in contact with was polite. How nice! Food was good, everyone was working hard and not one person was standing around doing nothing. An enjoyable meal, thank you!

We stopped by on Saturday and were in town for the football hall of fame weekend. The host was very pleasant and made good conversation on the way to our seat. The server was very professional and we ordered. The food was out very quickly and was great. I ordered the royal red robin and it was perfect.  This is a great place for familiar or a good meal.

Please, please please, pay heed to the bad reviews on here!  I didn't and had a horrible anniversary dinner there with my fiance back in mid-July.  Yes, we got seated right away, but the service was so-so. We barely saw our waiter unless we flagged him down.   Then there was this:  "Could we just get water?" "Is bottled okay?" Which is the exact same thing as:  "Could we get Pepsis?" "Is Coke okay?" We assumed by how they said it, that there was no price difference. WRONG. $2 for a bottle of water obviously bought from a Big Lots or Aldis where they sale those huge 24 packs for $3-4. I wouldn't have even minded paying if they gave use a brand name, decent water, but they gave us cheapest of the cheapest (when other tables served after us where given Dasani). You always tell people that there's a charge. Then, instead of telling us that they were taking it off the bill, the waiter just walked away after we complained. Ten minutes later he came back with a changed bill. That's great, but you should also tell the customer what you're doing.  The food was sub par, but the guacamole was  clearly bad before I touched it. I thought that maybe it was because avocado goes brown quickly. When I tasted it, I was wrong. It was so far bad that I wanted to lock it up. When the server came back and I explained, he condescendingly gave a speech about oxidation and avocados. When I again said that it wasn't that it looked like it had good bad, but that it TASTED rotten and I wanted it off my bill, he instead insisted on bringing me more stating that "maybe this one is from last's night batch." He brought out another, bigger one with guac that looked as bad and tasted as bad as the first. He refused to listen when I said it had gone bad this time as well and wouldn't take it off my bill. I was pissed, but this was my anniversary and wasn't going to let myself be annoyed by 2 bucks.  However, the rest of my anniversary was ruined by the fact that I got sick soon after the meal and continued to be for almost 2 days. My fiance didn't get sick and the only thing different from our meals was that darn guacamole. The guacamole was bad and they refused to listen. Ridiculous way to run a restaurant.

I still enjoy getting a burger and endless fries here, but it isn't what it used to be. When they opened, this place was over and above with quality, quantity and service. Now its just another adequate place in an area that is flooded with choices.  Service is definitely hit & miss depending on your luck of the draw. Food quality is good, but nowhere near what it used to be and no better than places that don't "specialize" in burgers. I almost feel like they've gotten too comfortable and they no longer need to impress anyone.

1st time at Red Robin & I'll be honest, the burgers were small and a huge disappointment :-(. For the price and menu stating premium burgers I really was expecting more. Remember Wendy's "Where's the Beef?" Commercial? That's how I felt. Been to many burger places across the US and was really disappointed. Go to Five Guys or even BK !

What is there to say?  It's red Robin!   The burgers were amazing.   The food came out quickly and it was hot and fresh.  The server was amazing.   She kept our glasses filled, recommend a couple specialty drinks at the time that we were happy we took her up on.  My husband tried a burger with pineapple on it per her suggestion and he said it was one of the best he ever had.  He never would have tried something like that without input from her. I will be going back next time I'm in Canton.

I felt like it was a busy time of day for a restaurant but also very unorganized. Felt very cramped sitting in the bar section. It was very unclear who our server was it was back and forth between two of them. Both were very nice. Burgers were very very greasy! Dessert was huge. I did find a piece of BBQ chicken in the dessert which grossed me out. I feel like it could have been a cleaner restaurant too.

This is a very busy place for lunch.  I don't understand why tho.  It's closer to a fast food joint.  Do you get a lot of burger and endless fries for your $$$.  But the fries are chewy and burgers are greasy.  Not my type of burger.

Red Robin has a great selection of burgers, and knows how to prepare them very well. Great service too. One of the best burgers in the North Canton area, and there is some serious competition. As locals, we know the good spots for various dinner types.
I just love red robin! Whiskey river bbq burger and bottomless fries with campfire sauce!:) you can't go wrong

every so ofter I go there. I know my value for my money is good.  I get a burger with endless steak fries. its good all the time. brad waits on me 99 percent of the time. he is a young man who is a gentleman and good server. Brad is nice he always does a good job I will go back

We went with a large group and they got us in very timely.  Our two waitresses  took very good care of us and made sure we didn't need anything.  Their burger selection  has vastly improved over the years. The southern burger was very delicious,  not over cooked. we will be back

It had been at least a year since I was at Red Robin the last time and todays visit was well worth the wait! I used my birthday reward for a free burger and bottomless fries as I do every year. Even though it was the begining of the lunch rush, I was seated right away......given a booth which I requested as getting onto the higher seats is difficult. Within just a minute or so, my wonderful waitress, Melanie came up, introduced herself and took my drink order......which was only water today. I had a difficult time in choosing which burger to get. Do I order my usual Mushroom and Swiss? Do I try the Royal with Bacon and fried egg? Hmmmmm the Prime Chophouse? YES PLEASE! Was so excited to bite into this burger when  Melanie brought it to me......medium cooked burger with just the right amount of pink inside, horseradish, sauteed mushrooms, melted provalone cheese, topped with crispy onion straws and steaksauce on a toased onion bun. From the first, (very messy), bite to the last, I was in burger heaven! Such a wonderful marriage of flavors.....I found my new, favorite Red Robin burger! When I ordered, I asked Melanie for a side of mayo to dip my fries in......most servers forget to bring it out....and she also brought out a side of the "campfire" sauce for my fries since we talked about it and both agreed how tasty it is......she didn't even charge me for it. She was an outstanding waitress and I made a point to mention it to the manager. Melanie was outgoing, super attentive, and a total rock star! I just can't say enough good things about her wonderful service. The next time you're craving a gourmet burger, try the Prime Chophouse and ask for Melanie as your server......you will not be disapointed! See you again VERY soon!

If Red Robin was still single, I would definitely be workin my game....but as it is, she is clearly married to great service and great burgers! Just a wonderful experience every time. I generally get the Whiskey River BBQ burger, with a side of campfire sauce. I'm sorry to say that I haven't branched out just alot because honestly, how can you improve on such a succulent menu option? I enjoyed the privilege of dining out with 7 of my good friends there, and I'm happy to tell you we downed 5 baskets of the famous bottomless fries before our meal even got started. That was followed by very copacetic burgers, along with endless glasses of the ever wonderful "freckled lemonade". As I waddled miserbly yet satisfied out the door, the staff nodded and smiled as if every thing was as it should be...not sympathising  with mental anguish I had just endured on whether or not to eat the last few fries and risk the possibilities of throwing up on a cute girl nearby, or rather watch some perfectly fantastic fries and heaven sauce (a.k.a. campfire sauce) be wisked away by the waitress, never to be seen again. (p.s. I ate the fries. Chalk it up to my inward daredevil)....        And now, for all the things wrong: . The end.

We went with a few friends on a busy Saturday. The burgers themselves were significantly smaller than they had been before the remodel. I ordered a side salad instead of fries and the spring mix greens were rotting! The server was very apologetic, and it certainly wasn't his fault. He quickly brought a basket of sweet potato fries at no extra charge for a replacement. But a minute later, the manager came to the table with a new salad! I just had rotting food in my mouth! I don't want anything even close to similar for a loooong time. I expected some sort of discount or dessert card or SOMETHING for receiving food that clearly should've been thrown out at least a week ago, but there wasn't anything. One of our friends did get HIS appetizer for free though. I'm not sure if it was because of the rotting salad or because of MY Red Robin card, no mention of it was ever made by our server or the manager. Its not the discount or the points I'm upset about its the feeling that the situation was not handled well by management. I'm upset because Ive loved this restaurant since they opened in our area and now I'll never feel comfortable eating there again.

A couple months ago, my hubby, and two of our friends came here to eat.. let me tell you, it was literally the most fun we have ever had out to dinner! Our server was awesome, (and her husband ironically works there and was working that night as well,) they were so much fun.. we were able to joke around with them the whole time, and it made the night so much more enjoyable. But aside from that, the food was AMAZING! The portions was incredible and the flavor was out of this world! I was so beyond happy with this place!!!
Burgers are good, service is almost always bad. If you are gluten free, the salt is NOT gluten free. They will tell you otherwise, but trust me, the coloring makes it NOT gluten free.

Sunday, Jan. 17th, 2:45 p.m. 35 minute wait. Lobby stuffed with people, nowhere to sit and wait. Awkwardly not enough room to stand. Hearing multiple orders being wrong around me while eating, while noticing my burger was not cooked the way I asked. Pink or no pink, what? I said pink, didn't get pink. I've never heard that way of saying it before, I may be wrong but I always thought it was med/med well/ well done. The fries are endless but my meal came out with like literally 9 fries. Had to pull my own chair to my table for a party of 6 while I watched multiple servers walk right by me and look at me awkwardly and walked away. Burger was still very good, and so were the fries. Service was good as well, but I feel the things above are things a restaurant needs to get down, even if they're busy.
Bad food. No better than a fast food burger as they grill them on a conveyor belt. And I pay gratuity for service, not a Ziosk.  All done with this place. Better beef elsewhere.

This experience was much better than the first time I went there 5 years ago. We had a larger group today. Waitress was very good. The appetizer was your normal fried veggies out of a bag. That's what the wife wanted not really something I like. The Big Ghost was very good. I love the well balanced flavors of heat. Glad to see the seasoning on the table for your fries.

Just walked out of the restaurant after sitting at a table for 5+ minutes with zero acknowledgment. Overpriced hamburgers are not worth that level of aggravation. Called the manager just to let them know that they had an issue to deal with, was told they were busy. They lost my business.only given one star because you can't give any less.

* Patient staff even though we were being indecisive.  * I pretty much only ever eat chicken tenders everywhere and I looove RR's.  * Fry portions were small but our server frequently offered more, though the food I got was more than enough anyway.

This is the worse Red Robin I've ever been to I ordered a cheeseburger well done and I receive the worst soggy pink burger so I asked our waiter to please give me one well done so what do they do bring me another very pink burger

The burgers here are just ok, nothing spectacular or special about this place. We were seated around 2:00 on a Sunday afternoon, after ordering our food (only 3 of us) it took 40 minutes for our meals to arrive. After we finished eating, our waitress then asked if we wanted more fries (they are all you can eat with your meal). A little too late to ask about refills at that time. I wouldn't choose to go back here.

This place was on my " bucket list" of restaurants.   Went for lunch, service was prompt.  Food was disappointing.   We ordered two appetizers,  Small stack of onion rings that were over cooked and bland, and nickel pickles--they were good.  Also ordered burgers that were nothing to rave about.  Most likely will not return.  For the price, I expected better.

Very long wait to get a table. Granted it was a Saturday evening, but an hour just to get a table for two is a little ridiculous. Food was ok. The sweet potato fries my wife got were barely lukewarm. Asked for different ones and got almost the same thing. My burger was the buzz Mac and cheese. There was barely any Mac and cheese, and it was white! Every picture, every advertisement available shows yellow Mac and cheese. Also not nearly as good as expected. Overall, just an average meal at best.

This was my first time at a Red Robin, and I've never been happier with a restaurant. Our server was on it with drink refills and fry refills. The portion sizes were great, and the food was amazing. Not terrible with price, either.

Our family of 6 was looking for a place to stop for dinner. We didn't want fast food, but we wanted a sit down place that was fast. The kids decided on Red Robin. The staff were very friendly from the minute we walked through the door. It was a Thursday night and looked busy to me (maybe not to the people that work there) because we got right in and seated within a minute or two.  Zach was our server who was awesome! He interacted with our kids, asked for our drink order and, if we wanted to put in an appetizer to start off. He returned with our drinks within a minute or two and proceeded to take our food order, with a smile I may add.  The food came in about 10-15 minutes, which I consider fast considering there are 6 meals to prepare. The food, I might add looked and tasted great. My wife ordered a burger that was wrapped in lettuce instead of the bun that she raved about. Three of my kids ordered from the children's menu (mac n cheese, burger, and corn dog mini's) which all of them devoured. My oldest daughter ordered a turkey burger and raved about the flavor of it. Personally, I ordered the Avo-Cobb-o salad that was absolutely delicious; possibly one of the best salads I've had.  Also, the pre-meal activities for the kids were impressive- they have chalkboards the kids can play with as well as touch screens with trivia games- this was an ingenious idea. I do want to mention that Zach was an incredible server and I would try to recruit him for a sales/marketing job if I had the chance. We highly recommend Red Robin at the strip to all families for a great family friendly dinner experience.

Our server was Mitch and he did an excellent job. We ordered the Banzai Burger hold the tomato and add onion straws & pickle on the side. It was fabulous. We also ordered the sweet potato fries and they were typical sweet potato fries. For starters we had the pretzel bites with very very good beer cheese dipping sauce. What was refreshing is that every part of our meal was done right and the service was on top of everything.
Server and wait staff were very friendly and courteous. We all had burgers that were cooked to perfection! Burgers had the "just off the grill" flavor! Highly recommend!

Went to Red Robin today for lunch after a long hiatus following horrible service and mediocre food the last visit. Unfortunately things have not improved.  We were seated at a dirty table...the hostess intentionally placed the menus over the remnants of the last guests rather than grab a cloth and clean it up.  The waitress was friendly and personable but didn't offer fry refills and also didn't check if we needed anything until we were halfway through the meal. The food was okay...fry refills were pathetic and way over salted. The place was overall pretty dirty...food all over the floor while 2 managers stood around with the mess in clear sight...and the back of those machines on the table...ugh are they ever cleaned?!? I wouldn't say I won't ever go back but I'm certainly in no rush...too many other options at that price point.

Went today around 4 pm, were told a 15 minute wait.  Hostess had NO help (not her fault at all!!!  Looking at you, management) and was frantic.  15 minutes comes and goes, a manager finally comes up to help her.  I've been waiting at the front to ask how much longer (were going on 10 minutes past our wait time now) and I'm completely ignored.  I get the chance to ask how much longer and she tells me that it'll be coming up and she has to get through this line first, with absolutely no mention of the fact we're 10 minutes past wait time.  They have 15+ people waiting to speak to a hostess!  In restaurants with manners, they notice someone has been waiting past the time and let them know they weren't forgotten about.  After I'm not told an actual time or apologized to over being 10 min past our wait time, NO thank you, I'll take my money elsewhere.  What a waste of 25 minutes.

Oh Red Robin, how I love your burgers. Seriously, they are very good. Not to mention, your choices for unlimited side options, really is quite the appeal. I just wish your service was always as predictable as your food. I have been to several Red Robin locations and either the service is fantastic or horrible. Not often is it right in the middle. I would have to say this time the service was about a 7. Not amazing enough to write home to mom about (anyhow. mom was present) and not mediocre enough to make me not want to return.  Let me start off with the interior of this place. I cannot say enough good things about the inside of this joint. Probably one of the nicest looking Red Robins I have been to (short of the Orlando location in FL.) From the awesome lights, to the cool red leather chairs to the amazing wall decor, this location was awesome. Definitely a very comfortable and inviting feel. On top of it, it was SUPER clean. You know me, I love me a good clean restaurant. This place delivers! The hostess at this location wasn't necessarily the nicest human I have come in contact with. She wasn't rude or mean, but considering that this is the first POC when you enter an establishment, I expect some personality darn it! Arrived at about 4pm and got seated relatively quickly. Our server was friendly (yet oddly absent at times). She greeted us within 5 minutes and we got our drinks within a reasonable period of time. She forgot the lemons on our drinks and despite being reminded, it was until our food arrived that we actually got them. We ordered a plethora of food items. We were a group of 8. I could write forever with detailed descriptions, but ain't no one got time for all that. So, here is a brief synopsis: 1) Onion ring short stack: Crispy and flavorful and PIPING HOT. Love the BBQ sauce they give...perfect to dip fries in too. 2) Fish N chips: Not a lot of fish pieces....definitely skimpy. Crispy on the outside and meaty on the inside. 3) Red Robin cheeseburger: A classic burger. Simple and yummy 4) Smoke N pepper burger: LOVE the bacon on this. The special smokey catsup is also awesome. The flavors on this are on point. 5) Bonzai burger: Sweet and salty with a slight Asian flare.  6) Mac n cheese side: Not your usual mac n cheese. It is a white sauce and covered in bread crumbs. Flavorful and cooked well 7) Steamed broccoli: cooked perfectly. Awesome unlimited side option that is so much healthier than fries. We also asked for melted butter and then seasoned with salt and pepper. 8) Side salad: I was not a huge fan of this. Mostly iceberg, it was far too white and sort of had a preservative flavor. I want to see more green....isn't that what salad is about? Maybe more romaine and some spinach or kale? 9) French fries: Crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. Paired with their seasoning blend, it makes them addicting. It stinks they come in such tiny portions.  10) Milkshakes: I do not drink these, but everyone who got one (two plain chocolate and one cookies and cream) said they were amazing! Overall, this was a winner winner burger dinner for my brothers 26th birthday bash. This location is on the Red Robin short list for sure!

Got the shrimp and clucks and I think I've had better food from school cafeterias. Soggy, bland fries, and plain chicken strips and fried shrimp. Fiance received the wrong shake and I had a poorly mixed drink. In no rush to come back.

Rude hostess. At 1pm, she said they had no tables available for 2 but we could sit outside, in 86 degree weather. Or it would be "a while" for a table, when I had to ask how long her response was I don't know 10 or 15 minutes. Really?!? There were several empty tables you could see from the front. She just looked disinterested in doing her job.  Normally, I wouldn't waste my time writing a review about the hostess, but this isn't the first time I've encountered this particularly inept hostess at this location.  Burgers are great here and servers are generally above average - only reason I gave 3 stars.  Get some new FRIENDLY host staff. It's the first impression of your business.

The food was really good, I enjoyed the bottomless root beer floats. If it wasn't for the bartender and co-workers talking and laughing so loudly that me and my wife couldn't enjoy each others company it would have been a 5 star visit.

Burgers were average, on par with a whopper. Bottomless fries? Our burgers came with 10 fries, I mistakenly ordered garlic fries. Fries were mushy and wet with huge pieces of garlic on them. Each person at the table asked for more fries (3 people), and they brought back two baskets with about 8 fries in them. Asked waitress (who was very nice) for another basket, which she got for us. Can honestly go to Wendy's for a better meal.

Today was our families first time to Red Robin. While our food was just OK, the service was terrible! It took over 10 mins for our waiter to even show up at our table to get a drink order. And he never came back after he served our food, we didn't receive a refill on our drinks or fries. Both of which were supposed to be "bottomless". I was disappointed, but it seemed like a good family atmosphere which was great for our 2 yr old.

Black and blue burger eh  I wasn't impressed and  $14.00+ made me think I should have gone somewhere else for lunch $3+ for a Coke is ridiculous  You did get unlimited fries  They are good too  The waiter Timothy Mo was the best - I'm sorry the food was lacking
We always enjoy a good Red Robin visit but tonight was made exceptional by our amazing server, Mason. Thanks for the laughs and the great service! Good luck with all you want in life!
Delicious food and nice location. Always super busy and full house. Service is lacking a little but otherwise, good place to eat with the family.

I wish I could give one review just for the carry out process and another for the food, because they do not align. I gave the 4 stars for the taste of the food, I have dietary restrictions and had to get a lettuce wrapped burger, it was one of the best burgers ive ever tasted, it had that open flame taste, and was very satisfying, I did not miss the bun. I have been going to red robin for years but i've never done takeout, it seems un-organized, first there is a curbside option, but when you order online it doesnt give you the curbside option, it says you must go inside to pick up, no big deal, but then you get inside and there is a line of people (because its lunch hour) waiting to pickup their food, and nobody standing at the front desk, there's also nobody at the front desk to greet people coming in to be seated so one of the guys from the bar area came over and started seating people because the lobby was full, i don't know about everyone else but when i order to go during the week its usually on my lunch hour and i dont have very much time to stand in a long line with nobody there to get my order.  I would say as a suggestion if any red robin managers are reading this, when it's lunch hour and you have to-go orders, at least have someone up front getting those orders.

A real effort to accommodate food allergies! Some restaurants offer a gluten free hamburger bun but this one is actually good! Our server gave me a tablet so I could find my own nutritional information. Delicious sweet potato fries! Fun atmosphere! This was my first visit and I will go back!
